==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|Cellophane noodles}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|はる|さめ|yomi=kun}}

parusame > ɸarusame > harusame. From {{m|ja|春|tr=haru||spring}} + {{m|ja|雨|tr=ame||rain}}. The medial -s- either represents {{w|epenthesis}} between two vowels or, more likely, is a reflex of an older form of the word {{m|ja|雨|tr=ame||rain}} only maintained in fossilized compounds. See also {{m|ja|小雨|tr=kosame||light rain}} and {{m|ja|稲|tr=shine||rice}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|acc=h|y=k|はるさめ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はるさめ}}

# [[spring]] [[rain]]
# [[cellophane noodle]], [[glass noodle]] – a type of transparent Asian noodle made from starch (such as mung bean starch, potato or canna starch), and water.
